intro: Dicrastylis gilesii var. laxa, commonly known as the slender dicrastylis, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly referred to as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. It typically grows in wetland or swampy habitats, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. This variety is distinguished by its relatively lax or loose growth habit compared to other varieties within the species.
